avdta.network.node

Class ConflictRegion

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.ConflictRegion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ConflictRegion
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a single conflict region in the conflict region model of reservation-based intersection control.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public int getId()
        Returns the id of this ConflictRegion. Ids are uniquely generated upon instantiation.
        Returns:

      • newTimestep

        public void newTimestep()
        Resets this ConflictRegion for the next time step This updates the capacity, and, if the ConflictRegion was blocked the last time step, saves some of the previous time step's capacity. This prevents situations in which vehicles are blocked by lack of ConflictRegion capacity and lack of Link receiving flow on alternative time steps. The blocked check is reset every time step and activated when a vehicle cannot move through this ConflictRegion.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this ConflictRegion to restart the simulation

      • getRemainingFlow

        public double getRemainingFlow()
        Returns:
        the remaining time step flow

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Link inc,
                       Link out,
                       double flow)
        This checks whether there is sufficient remaining flow to move a vehicle which requires the specified flow. If not, this ConflictRegion is marked as blocked.
        Parameters:
        inc - the incoming Link
        out - the outgoing Link
        flow - equivalent flow of the vehicle. This may be reduced for autonomous vehicles due to lower following headways.
        Returns:
        whether a vehicle with the specified equivalent flow can move from the incoming link to the outgoing link

      • update

        public void update(Link inc,
                   Link out,
                   double flow)
        Moves a vehicle requiring the specified flow
        Parameters:
        inc - the incoming Link. This is used for adjusting the flow required.
        out - the outgoing Link
        flow - equivalent flow of the vehicle. This may be reduced for autonomous vehicles due to lower following headways.

      • adjustFlow

        public double adjustFlow(Link inc,
                         Link out)
        Adjusts the required flow for the specified turning movement
        Parameters:
        inc - the incoming Link
        out - the outgoing Link
        Returns:
        adjust the required flow for vehicles turning from the specified incoming and outgoing links.
